Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the impact of the planned nuclear plant repair on the percentage of pass-throughs in electric bills.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide sufficient evidence or data to support the specific percentage of pass-throughs mentioned.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the repair of the damaged nuclear plant will only increase the percentage of pass-throughs in electric bills, without providing evidence or alternative explanations.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the increase in pass-throughs in electric bills, such as changes in fuel costs or other factors not mentioned in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim may falter in providing a clear explanation of what "pass-throughs" are and how they contribute to electric bills.
Understate: The claim may be understating the potential impact of the repair on the percentage of pass-throughs in electric bills, as it only mentions an increase without specifying the magnitude.
